flavor_text_entries.black:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and
attack their foes with violent blizzards.
flavor_text_entries.white:
If both heads get angry simultaneously,
this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying
everything in snow.
flavor_text_entries.black-2:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and,
when angry, cause violent blizzards.
flavor_text_entries.white-2:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and,
when angry, cause violent blizzards.
flavor_text_entries.x:
If both heads get angry simultaneously, this
Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything
in snow.
flavor_text_entries.y:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they make
snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,
cause violent blizzards.
flavor_text_entries.omega-ruby:
If both heads get angry simultaneously, this
Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything
in snow.
flavor_text_entries.alpha-sapphire:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they make
snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,
cause violent blizzards.
flavor_text_entries.sun:
Each of its two heads has a brain, and when
they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies
by exhaling a violent blizzard.
flavor_text_entries.moon:
Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live
relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds
inside its body.
flavor_text_entries.ultra-sun:
It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can
create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love
from skiers and snowboarders.
flavor_text_entries.ultra-moon:
Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted
by the day’s light, stick to each other and
freeze together in the cold return of night.
flavor_text_entries.sword:
When its anger reaches a breaking point, this
Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes
every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
flavor_text_entries.shield:
People believe this Pokémon formed when two
Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is
roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
